title: Beijing opposes 'bully' US for 50% tariffs on India
summary: China's ambassador to India Xu Feihong says Beijing "firmly opposes" Washington's steep tariffs on Delhi.

title: UK backs down in Apple privacy row, US says
summary: UK authorities have demanded access to Apple users' protected files when required for investigations.

title: Woman charged with concealing birth of deceased child after infant’s body found in WA drain
summary: The woman, in her 30s, had been assisting police with enquiries since Wednesday A woman has been charged with concealing the birth of a deceased child after the body of a baby boy was found in drain in Perth. The woman, in her 30s, had been assisting police with enquiries since Wednesday following the discovery of the infant on Monday afternoon. Continue reading...

title: Outback Wrangler star agreed helicopter pilot had ‘thrown everyone under the bus’ in covert recording played in court
summary: Matt Wright has pleaded not guilty to three counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The reality TV star Matt Wright’s home was bugged with listening devices and phone taps for three months as police sought evidence of a cover-up following a fatal helicopter crash, a jury has heard. Covert recordings of Wright’s conversations have played a key part in his trial at the Northern Territory supreme court in Darwin. Continue reading...

title: Friday briefing: Is Israel’s plan for Gaza City a full-scale assault – or political theatre?
summary: In today’s newsletter: After Israeli officials announced a stepped-up military operation in the city, Palestinians and the world wait to see what happens next Good morning. Israel claims to have launched the first stages of a sweeping military operation to conquer Gaza City – the administrative heart of the strip – warning that a million people could be forced from their homes , sparking a wave of fear among residents. In the past few nights Palestinians have described relentless bombardments, with thousands already scrambling to escape, while others are too starved or frail to evacuate. UK news | Protesters at the next mass demonstration against the ban on Palestine Action will withhold their details from officers to force en-masse processing at police stations in an effort to make it “practically impossible” to arrest everyone. Ukraine | Moscow threw Donald Trump’s Ukraine peace initiative into disarray on Thursday, insisting it must have a veto over any postwar support for the country as its forces carried out a large-scale overnight missile barrage. Immigration | Refugee support organisations have been forced to install safe rooms in their premises, relocate to less visible sites and in some cases close their offices in response to the threat of far-right violence, the Guardian can reveal . US news | A federal judge in Miami late on Thursday ordered the closure of the Trump administration’s notorious “Alligator Alcatraz” immigration jail within 60 days and ruled that no more detainees were to be brought to the facility while it was being wound down. Health | Baby food manufacturers have been given 18 months to improve the quality of their products in England amid mounting concerns that leading brands are nutritionally poor. Continue reading...

title: EU looks at public blockchains like Ethereum and Solana for digital euro rollout
summary: The EU's exploration of public blockchains for a digital euro could enhance cross-border transactions, challenging dollar dominance in global finance. The post EU looks at public blockchains like Ethereum and Solana for digital euro rollout appeared first on Crypto Briefing .

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy rules out China as security guarantor in any peace deal

title: Citadel Expands Commodity Trading to Australia With Power Hires
summary: Ken Griffin’s $68 billion hedge fund firm Citadel is expanding commodities trading to Australia, hiring Shell Plc senior trader Keith Handbury, according to a person familiar with the matter.
